page.title: 03BLAGDON LAKE
page.content: IN 1891 A{DAM}WAS BUILT BELOW BLAGDON ACROSS THE{RIVER YEO.}THE DAM TOOK EIGHT YEARS TO BUILD.THIS FLOODED PART OF THE VALLEY AND MADE BLAGDON LAKE. IT TOOK FOUR YEARS TO FILL. THE LAKE IS BIG BUT NOT AS BIG AS CHEW VALLEY LAKE.THE WIDTH OF THE LAKE IS ABOUT 1KM AND THE LENGTH IS ABOUT 3KM. THE PERIMETER IS ABOUT 9KM. {FISH}WERE PUT INTO THE LAKE IN 1904. THERE ARE TWO MAIN TYPES OF FISH IN THE LAKE.THEY ARE THE RAINBOW TROUT AND THE BROWN TROUT.THE HEAVIEST BROWN TROUT TO BE CAUGHT WAS CAUGHT BY MR.C. FRANK IN 1926.IT WEIGHED 11LB.12OZ. THE{FISHERMEN}USE LEAD TO WEIGH THE LINE DOWN ,BUT A LAW IS GOING TO BE PASSED THROUGH PARLIAMENT IN 1986 SO THAT FISHERMEN HAVE TO USE PLASTIC WEIGHTS.THESE WONT HARM WILDFOWL. YOU CAN'T SWIM IN THE LAKE BECAUSE THE FISHERMEN GET ANGRY!
